messages.title: Labour delivers for Brighton
messages.content: The Greens say this Government has failed Brighton. This is not true. Here in the city centre Labour has delivered: Neighbourhood Policing and Local Action Teams have helped cut crime by a third, The new NHS walk-in health centre near Brighton station open seven days a week, The Jubilee Library.

messages.title: Labour achievements - the new Royal Alexandra Children's Hospital

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Labour is committed to investing in the economy and protecting our schools and hospitals.
The new NHS walk-in health centre near Brighton station open seven days a week.
£1,100 more on every child's education compared to what the Conservatives spent in 1997.
Neighbourhood Policing and Local Action Teams have helped cut crime by a third.

mentions.tacticalSituation: If you don't want a Conservative government, vote Labour. A Green protest vote makes a Conservative government more likely. One Green MP changes nothing; a Labour Government makes all the difference.

issues.economy: Labour is committed to investing in the economy and protecting our schools and hospitals.
issues.education: £1,100 more on every child's education compared to what the Conservatives spent in 1997.
issues.governance: Neighbourhood Policing and Local Action Teams have helped cut crime by a third.
issues.health: The new NHS walk-in health centre near Brighton station open seven days a week.

leaflet.personalStatement: Your local Labour candidate, Nancy Platts, will be a strong voice for hard working people and families, pensioners and students. She will fight hard for the many, not just the rich few.

contactInformation.address: Promoted by David Arnold on behalf of Nancy Platts of 179 Preston Road, Brighton, BN1 6AG.

images.caption: Nancy Platts with a resident in front of the Royal Alexandra Children's Hospital.

leaflet.additionalNotes: The latest independent opinion poll commissioned by The Argus shows that Labour's Nancy Platts is in the lead to become MP for Brighton Pavilion. The Conservatives are in second place and the Liberal Democrats fourth.
